False Spider, Solifugid

This spiderlike creature has ten leg, the front two ending in sucker-like clamps. Its front sports two spider-like eyes and a set of large, oversized mandibles.



Solifugid

CR 3

XP 800
N Medium vermin
Init +2; Senses darkvision 60 ft.; Perception +4
DEFENSE
AC 15, touch 12, flat-footed 13 (+2 Dex, +3 natural)
hp 27 (5d8+5)
Fort +5, Ref +3, Will +1
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft.
Melee 2 pincers +6 (1d6+3 plus grab), bite +6 (1d6+1)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Special Attacks constrict (1d6+3)
STATISTICS
Str 16, Dex 14, Con 13, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 2
Base Atk +3; CMB +6 (+10 grab); CMD 18 (30 vs. trip)
Skills Perception +4; Racial Modifiers +4 Perception
ECOLOGY
Environment warm land
Organization solitary or colony (2-5)
Treasure none


Solifugids, also known as camel spiders, are at least 6 feet long but can grow to a length of 12 feet.
